JuKZPcYNkznziPkk9Fs4qQ.text: 5 Stars you must be kidding! Full review = foodiefondue.blogspot.co…

ori-pCnd4GPy65W83bVXeg.text: Amaing place. Try the Buffalo Bill, the Strawberry and white chocolate, the italian job, and banoffee pie! They all melt in your mouth and are decent prices. Two locations as well!

HQGo1yeAB1k_Qug9krocjw.text: Been here twice now and on each occasion I have the Banoffee Pie and both times they were AMAZING!!!!!!The first time we went was on a Saturday afternoon which is not the best time as the place was rammed, unfortunately due to the layout you get inconsiderate people hawking your table and standing over you as you eat waiting for you to get up so they can jump in or if you sit on a big table and there is two of you then you get people asking to sit next to you which I absolutely hate.The second time I went was a Weds at about 1pm and the place was empty so I reckon this is a weekend place?EIther way the crepes were really nice and I will go again.I do think though that they should re think the sitting arrangements but given the size of the place they have done the best they can.

Qwptsze35OTp7AR6fCYv3g.text: Some of the best crepes I have ever eaten, with delightful flavours such as philly cheesesteak and banoffee pie! If you have a preconception that crepes are boring and just stuffed with nutella or plain sugar, Creme de la Crepe will change your mind. I will definitely be going back there again sometime when I'm in the Covent Garden area and looking for a bite to eat. To read my full review, visit my site here:london-insider.co.uk/201…

RrmQNzKRbZRweoijIeXgbg.text: Nice place to chill whilst browsing Covent Garden area. The space is designed very well in case you are looking for a little hide out either with your beloved newspaper, laptop or other half. The wooden decor strikes a great balance between contemporary and homey.They serve super tasty crepes which you can either have sweet or savoury-seriously one of the best I've had in London. The fillings and toppings are of great variation and will fill up your rumbling tummy whilst pleasing your taste buds(click on the website to get going.) The other option include salads, smoothies,milkshakes, coffee..I recommend the Go Fishin' Salad and mango/passionfruit/pineapple smoothie (if you fancy ditching your crape date/looking to ditch some waist inches.) The staff are really friendly too, I completely forgot in what area I was...

photos.caption: Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom

HPNcRAYOw-KnXtF-ro-QBg.text: had two crepes both savoury they were really tasty & filling, didn't get change to have a sweet one would deffo want to try one reasonable priced too,

ggtsxoGSt1KA9FeFhEWLEQ.text: Batter, it's a fabulous thing. It goes well around fish, with sausages and in Scotland, a coating for Mars bars. Here at Creme de la Crepe, hidden in one of the converted arches of Covent Garden's market, they spread it out on a hot skillet and make it into Crepes. Also know as pancakes. Now in the unsuspecting spot you may not expect to find anything of a foodie dream, I mean who really goes here except teenagers and tourist, but you should not judge a book by it's cover. Sickeningly cute with pink and grey polka-dots, the little man made cave is suprisingly light and airy. Another element that caught my eye was the menu. Yes, yes we all know that Nutella needs to be in a crepe but these are "Creme de la Crepes", expect a "Cheap Date" with Balieys, and a "Buffalo Bill" with hot wing sauce and shredded chicken. It's mind blowing what these guys can put in a pancake. After reading Cate S's review and having Laura N practically march me down there for a crepe, I was very happy yet not completely satisfied with my Friday lunch... well on Pancake day I can eat about 5 pancakes, yup it's a family record! So here I would be paying almost £25 for a meal of pancakes, not great value for money. But saying that, as lunch for a little snack, trust these tossers they'll have you full of crepe in no time!

photos.caption: Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom

YEMe0ouO-e2r7qdMSEMOUw.text: It's pancake day, and after a sneak-peek event last week, I knew *exactly* where I was going!Créme de la Crêpe is not just another creative name, and after being introduced to this fine establishment tucked away in the underbelly of Covent Garden Market, I truly agree that this truly is as good is it gets in the crêpe department. The creme of the crêpe-crop, if you will... Oh... wait, what's that? You did already? Oh... I see. Right.The only problem is deciding what to order: Are you going to be sacrilegious and order a (gasp) savory pancake? If so, you've gotta go with the Philly Cheese-crepe. Or the buffalo bill. Or the smoked salmon. Or the Italian Job. Or, or, or... (You really can't go wrong.)In the sweet department, it's all about the banoffee pie. It changes lives. Believe. *Quick tip: take a cheeky peek in the corner and you'll see a shrine to American goodies! Marshmallow creme, Mars Bars, Skippy extra crunchy peanut butter, Baby Ruth, Kool-Aid... Oh Yeah!

q2xLTXn3QozQdEIYNrC5XA.text: This place is phenomenal. How can so much goodness can be crammed into one menu.The savoury list sings like a chorus of angels. The sweet list could give Satan a lesson in temptation. I went for the Philly Cheesesteak crepe. It was so good I could of dropped my pants and made love to it. Every mouthful was a mini orgasmic experience. No joke, I was in food nirvana. At £5.50 it was the most expensive crepe. It isn't a meal but adding a sweet crepe as dessert will leave you feeling satisfied like never before. My sources tell me the Banofee Pie crepe is a taste tingling sensation.The cute cave like interior only adds to the wonder of the place. You can also purchase salads and smoothies, but really, you'd be doing yourself a major injustice by missing out on the incredible crepes.Wow, wow, wow. There is a God in heaven, and he is French.

-viXu8U55cMPcMEqzCPbkA.text: This is an excellent place for a meal or tide-you-over snack. Situated in frenetic Covent Garden, it has indoor seating and a broad assortment of crepes, both breakfast-y and lunch/dinner-y. Everyone seemed to enjoy their order, and you're just steps away from the hubbub and entertainment in the courtyard. Prices were reasonable, but not what I would call surprisingly cheap.

a3IZlloe6w0JxsdmASUagg.text: Here's the thing, folks. This place may be in the bowels of the Covent Garden Piazza, but it's worth the trip downstairs. Unfortunately, Covent Garden haven't sorted them out with a proper sign yet, but once you find Creme de la Crepe it is positively AMAZING.Run by Nick, a lovely chap who reminds of of Jamie Oliver (in all the good ways) Creme de la Crepe is the kind of place I would like to live in if I didn't have any moral standards, respect for others, or regard for my waistline. I would like to live there, install Wifi, and eat savory crepes, the sweet crepes, and then savory crepes, and then maybe a smoothie all the live long day.It would become my own personal Gluttony Palace of Shame.Never mind how awesome the pink, black, and polkadot decor is - let's talk food.The crepes are f***ing STELLAR. Including delicious American-style condiments and sauces such as Buffalo Wing Sauce and Ranch Dressing, the savory crepes will bring anyone to their knees. Plus, with creative names such as "Buffalo Bill", "Cheeky Cow", "Piggy that went to Market" and "Love Hate Thing" (made with Marmite, of course) even ordering your crepe is enjoyable. The cute wooden booths, alcoves and its retro, artsy atmosphere make this place one of my favorite finds in London. Savory or sweet, salad or smoothie, Nick and his fantastic and friendly staff will not disappoint. And with your average crepe costing only about £4, I simply can't see where this place goes wrong.

pNu9QJOBPsst6YvEDAhZYg.text: Creme de la Crepes is an interesting little place in Covent Market, selling the unusual but delicious staple known as a 'Crepe'. A native French snack very similar to pancakes, they are normally made with sugar in the ingredients and served with a selection of condiments. Walking into this shop, you quickly realise that you're not going to be sitting down on site and eating one of their delicious crepes, due to the fact they have about 3 seats available. You can argue though that a crepe is a strictly mobile kind of snack, eaten out of your hands on the move. They sell a wide variety, including savoury ones, and the prices aren't 'So' bad, about £3.50 a sweet crepe (try the plain with honey or jam) and £4.80 for a savoury one. They sell some American only chocolate bars as well, though why you'd want to pay in excess of £1.00 I wouldn't know. Most of the workers are young, virile males so I expect they're targeting a female audience! So handsome...

photos.caption: Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom

9iLX8E8X2PTKBn9P5oNRug.text: Mmm.  I went here on pancake day (I know, I know, I take forever to get around to reviewing things) and can't wait to go back.  The selection of crepes, savory and sweet, is fantastic.  I had the Italian Job, which is a savory crepe with goat's cheese, pesto, "sun-blushed" tomatoes, and rocket.  A bit pricey at £4.95 to eat in, I didn't at all regret dropping a fiver on it.  It was just enough to fill me up, and I paired it with Coca Cola in a glass bottle (so fancy).  The wooden booths and large tables are nice, if not the most comfortable seating in the world, and although it's relatively small and there were a fair amount of people around, it didn't feel claustrophobic.  Plus (perhaps because it was pancake day?) I received a voucher for a free crepe!  Speaking of which, I've got to go use that before it expires...you'll excuse me.

7UmSq2d3CR1ndXr5FFtRiw.text: Best place for Crepes I found in London so far. They taste like a quick holiday in France. The Crepes are freshly made, thin and taste wonderful. The cafe itself is cosy and a very nice place to sit and relax.Unfortunately it's not wheelchair accessible inside. There is a hidden lift at Covent Garden to reach the lower floor (ask security) but the cafe has two steps.

wMXDzQbnCRmeQeo518Q1Pw.text: If you love crepes then this will be like heaven for you. The extensive menu has both sweet and savoury options and they also serve salads and other snacky bits. I had the cheeky monkey which is Nutella and banana - I can definitely recommend it, although I did feel slightly sick afterwards! Other menu highlights include one with Baileys in, yummy! The service is not speedy, but you feel like each crepe is prepared with care. Mine has just the right amount of filling and my friend said the same thing. It's cheaper if you take away so on a sunny day I'd do just that. There isn't a huge amount of seating if you want to eat in.

oDjWqBSJb9RJH9D-osfieQ.text: My friends and I passed by this place by accident on our way to the Underground. We decided to stop by for a quick dessert and coffee break.  We ordered the wide load crepe and substituted the whipped cream for bananas. First of all, the service was super nice and allowed us to substitute ingredients without asking any questions. Secondly, my friend ordered a double shot expresso and the girl serving us was kind enough to ask if she gave my friend enough expresso because the machine didn't pump out as much as it should have. The crepe was DELICIOUS! The chocolate bar mixed with strawberries, ginger cookies, and bananas was the best combination! I shared one with my friend and it was the perfect afternoon snack. The price is reasonable and the food is great! The atmosphere is also pretty cool with several other cool/funny names for other crepes. I was very tempted to try another crepe by myself. A MUST go for afternoon snack!

NSut66w50k1DtCg0y4H89w.text: The Crepes more than awful, I am even thinkong of a stronger word to describe how bad there were.

X19EJQWcFfMWD-wm-xtfPw.text: Crepes were of terrible quality. Hard and crispy, plus the toppings were terrible--thrown in in big chunks.

OGlYZ3zc7KmBDj5jMHmXjQ.text: Creme de la Crepe sells a delicious list of sweet and savoury crepes which you can eat in or take away. The place itself is well designed, with a simple yet funky clean layout. Stone flooring, sharp angular wooden tables, in cavernous white painted brick walls.  Their crepes come in al sorts of flavours and each have interesting names - they are an interesting take on the usual traditional crepes. For instance, Wide Load which has Mars bar, strawberries, ginger biscuits, and double cream. They also do Banoffee pie crepe, yum! The savoury selection is very interesting as well, such as Fired Up with pastrami, passata, harissa, mozzarella, black olives and rocket. Or their Love Hate Thing, which to me sounds awful, with marmite, mayonnaise, cheddar, cherry tomatoes and rocket.

CwjfOUkC4e4V9QP9HNwI5Q.text: Went passed the place and had this place on my mind every day since.  I'm in love with the strawberries and cream crepe as the cute French girl that makes it for me always has a smile on her face.  The texture of the crepe is fluffy and perfect with every bite.  It's truly a delight and I plan on coming back here at least 3x before the end of my trip cz you can't get this kind of heaven in Houston, Texas.

71v9uOCdLgpfSfB7_kWcxA.text: sweet crepes dripping with chocolate and strawberries are my kryptonite.  and creme de la crepe left me a limp drooling female.  this is the perfect place to seek out while shopping around the market when you get that snack-urge.  its on the bottom, nearby where the street performers perform to the cafe audience.  it seems that this place is PACKED at all hours of the day.  if you are lucky enough, you may snag a wooden table and eat indoors.  it gets a bit toasty inside, though, and they do charge you more for eating in.  now, my heart still lies with "belly good" in japantown in san francisco, but creme de la crepe is definitely a close second.also, if you dont mind a crazy frenzied crepe crowd, go on tuesdays at happy hour (6-7pm) and you can get 2 for 1 on all sweet crepes!

0y5lmQscOJINFNeGmzo03w.text: had an amazing set of crepes before visiting the NHM down the road. loved it so much, we came back for another set after the museum! good smoothie too.  The sweet crepes are not as stunning as the savoury and the staff seem a little low on energy (though i can understand that, it not probably being someone's dream job to make crepes all day and all) but def would come back! nyum x

72Gt6dWQWHqfZAOwMmWyVw.text: Let me start with saying I've probably eaten here 10-15 times. I love this creperie. They have a wide variety of both sweet and savory crepes for a good price. Additionally, they normally have 3 special crepes every week. I always bring friends and family here for a lunch or snack and it's always a solid choice. I personally love the Cheeky Monkey crepe (banana and Nutella crepe), but many others enjoy the classic Suzette crepe as well as the cute Banoffee pie crepe. When it comes to savory crepes, I personally enjoy the vegetarian crepe, but my friends have ordered a variety and loved them all. I highly recommend this place for lunch or a snack. It's normally busy but not packed and it's conveniently located in Covent Garden on the bottom floor.

photos.caption: Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom. Lemon Drop
Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom. Cheeky Monkey (Nutella and banana)

IXe4k1AWzew6DBxRd8HO2Q.text: I'm not a big fan of crepes but needs must as it had been a long day of walking around and around sugar levels were low, we needed sugar!!It's only a small establishment so I would recommend grabbing a seat prior to ordering, as if like on my visit many people were sitting and chatting away and it looked to me as though they had long consumed whatever crepes they had ordered!!I'm all for sit relax after enjoying your food but in a small place like this please think of others who might want to sit and eat something, or don't put your shopping onto the seats!!Anyway service was bright and cheerful until I asked for the Strawberry Cheese cake only to be told they had run out of the cheese cake base and it had been replaced with ginger biscuits!!I was too tired to think to long about it so went with it. They ask you to take a seat (if you can find one!!) until your number is called. Perhaps they saw the disappointment on our faces, as the cheese cake was not to be real cheese cake, but when our order was ready they brought it over to us, I did mention its a small place.It was not bad but it was not cheese cake but it certainly did hit the spot.If you are a keen crepes fan then its worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom. Menu

r4ObZjLWzDkVFiV8z7QNhg.text: To be honest, the crepe I had here was probably the best food I've had in London so far. I found this place on Yelp and had to give it a try. My friends and I all love crepes. My friends got the "French Kiss," dark chocolate, grand marnier, unrefined sugar and the "Cheap Date," mars bars and baileys. I got the "Nutty Professor," nutella and peanut butter. All of our crepes came in a timely manner, about ten minutes. We did come here on a Wednesday afternoon so it wasn't busy at all. My friend who got the "French Kiss" was given the wrong crepe though. They gave her the "Lady Loves," strawberries, dark chocolate and whipped cream. She still enjoyed the crepe but it was their fault for messing it up. My other friend loved her "Cheap Date" and my "Nutty Professor" was absolutely amazing. Probably one of the best crepes I've ever had. Easily. It was full of flavor and I was so sad when it was all gone. BEST CREPE PLACE IN ALL OF LONDON!

photos.caption: Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom. Lady Loves - Crepe with dark chocolate & strawberries topped with whipped cream
Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom. Nutty Professor Crepe - Nutella & Peanut Butter topped with whipped cream

8ZZqi6zn_3SJG4KnCA1lEw.text: Utterly delightful! I searched for this cute dessert ppce all around Covent GArden. I almost gave up but am happy i persevered. (It is downstairs on the lower floor). Exhilarated that I found this gem, I then struggled with what to order. I wanted to try everything. I settled on the Nutella banana crepe with a baileys drizzle. It was finger lickin good. I really wanted another one, but I restrained myself.

iG-7b946DLENiuijsQ6x3g.text: Arrived here to a suspiciously different pricing than the online menu for the restaurant, not impressed. Trying to rip off consumers on Pancake Tuesday?

photos.caption: Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom

49dPDZJN6ShvzxWNb0lFDA.text: I loved this place. I got the money chunky I think crepe Nutella and banana . I loved it but their menu is so cool. They offer more choices of crepes that I will try real soon like dying to try the Milky Way. The place is cute and small . Don't miss it

Hpl9cA_d7guHvdM9NdNWqg.text: Its a small yet busy place in the heart of Covent Garden.  You order from the counter, grab your serviette, after a short wait your crepe is ready. Having few seatings gives you a nice break to fill up your energy before continue to discover more things in Covent Garden. Or you can always have your take away while watching street performances. Cheeky monkey... Whenever I want to go for savoury crepes, I remember how nice nutella&banana combination in a crepe and it hits the spot! I visited this place quite a lot of time and always had the same one so I cannot judge the other options on the menu. They do tea, almost of kinds of coffees and smoothies. Also few fizzy drinks, juices. If the other options don't chance your mind in the Piazza, its a sweet place to try.

aMElsq1IBvzOHKivpbs19w.text: My wife and I came here one night for dessert and we loved it.  I had the Cheap Date and my wife had the French Kiss. It was a great way to close out a long day roaming around London.

lVYRO8pMVgcnSUea30cmVA.text: o9.o6.14I wished my first was here! I know this is dessert but I would rather have dessert as my first meal than fish and chip. This place is so cute, just simply cute. And yes, the desserts were tasty too. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom

tBGRtfWAGLO-umFtL_f7uw.text: Yummmm. This place has really good bang for your buck. I ordered the "Gone Fishin" crepe which has: hot smoked salmon, spring onions, lemon juice, black pepper mayonnaise and rocket. There was a lot of fresh, flavorful salmon in the crepe and the flavors went really well together. The total came to 5.85 pounds so it's a reasonable dinner if you're in Covent Garden. The place is pretty cute with a tarvern-like feel and cute/chic decor. However, they also have outdoor seating and music playing outside which is really nice on a hot day.The only thing is, the portion is pretty small (at least compared to American sizes) so if you're really hungry, maybe order a side from one of the cute restaurants nearby. I really want to try the banana nutella crepe here and the Nick the Greek (Falafel, hummus, tsatziki, sunblushed tomatoes, red onion, black olives, extra virgin olive oil, oregano, fresh lemon juice, rocket for 5.75 pounds).Definitely recommend this place, and grab a macaron from nearby Laduree if you're in the mood for a small but delicious dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom. Smoked salmon, mayo, green onion and rocket crepe. YUM

ISGhHReja274tyiA6gASDQ.text: We needed a break after walking around Covert Garden. This pink, cavern-like crepery is tucked into the bottom level corner. We ordered a couple of basic dessert crepes to share,  chocolate and a nutella/strawberry (my favorite) as well as coffee. The crepes were nice, light and a nice amount of filling. They were not huge, a good size for something sweet. I do not think that they were better than other good crepes I have had elsewhere, but they were good.They also had some interesting savory crepes that we did not have a chance to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom

rOpLo4IL_uGTWjidxgtyuQ.text: Delicious! I got the salmon savoury crepe and the strawberry nutella sweet crepe. My crepes were prepared quickly and I only waited about 5-10 minutes for both. Seating is limited, but then again it is a small shop in Covent Garden. The crepes are a bit too expensive in my opinion, but the two I ordered were enough to fill me up even though I was starving. Definitely would be coming back here again! Also, there is free wifi (password is on the wall I think), which is nice considering phone reception is not great inside.

S4kSv85_LyYBoQwHuMULEg.text: Fast, delicious crepes, both sweet and savory kinds. Tiny space in Covent Garden. You order at the counter & they bring the food to you. Pretty good latte, too. Strawberry crepe was filled with jam not fresh berries, so a bit too sweet. Savory was called the piggy that went to market, and we liked it better

photos.caption: Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom

hSsVJuoWsZiJWAb1mYd2Zg.text: run-up to Have your crepes..And make it your crepe Day its a great time to treat yourself and have a break  with a -thin French crepes . It's a nice place ... Crepes is served fresh .. It taste yummy .. I ordered crepes with Nutella .. Prices is good .. Staff are friendly

photos.caption: Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom

qGE4G0LOrK8bc2XBZz-pGw.text: Great taste. . I had a crep & hot drink.. Friendly staff.. i'd recommend this place..

CYxFu0ufSEZvl0inbJ0Eug.text: This place could be great, but it's just not 4 stars. 3 stars for the food and 1 star for the service. The staff were neither friendly nor helpful. The guy who was taking my order had such poor English he just could not understand what I was saying. "No ranch dressings please" "cherry tomatoes?" "No, ranch dressing" "no cheese?" That is not even remotely close! He didn't even apologise and the girl behind him end up putting in the order in the computer. He didnt tell me the order number either.The crepes are not French styled (at least Northern France). They were far too thick, spongy, and crispy. The ingredients were fine. Dont really have any complaints about the taste or the amount of food. The coffee is your usual non-espresso-shop quality.

CATnBpJLzAnVIYC7CZprzA.text: The crepes are of decent quality, though a bit over-spongy, which makes sense given they use a mass production crepe machine rather than being hand made.  The sweet crepe I ate was fine.  Unfortunately it is not fine enough to be memorable.  Service is friendly and can be slow during peak demand.   The venue feels a bit more like a basement converted into a cafe, which is not a compliment.  Crowds make the small space even more cramped, particularly in cold weather when nobody wants to sit outside.  Fortunately the location is great in touristy, high traffic, Covent Gardens, where there are few other options for crepes or small cheap places to dine.

0TD9DkT3waBo3Y98ewj1CA.text: So...let's just say, that when I order a crepe with Nutella, I expect a decent amount of Nutella in it, specially because it is 4 pounds...So that being said, there was barely any Nutella inside of it, the crepe was fine, but If I wanted a plain crepe, I would have ordered one.I don't think I will be back, at least not for the sweet crepes.

FlWTvx_FsDdnlotbFomiDg.text: Oh December 18...How I will never forget you.  We started off on such good terms.  Our last day in London and it's beautifully snowing...and then snowing...and then more snow.  And yes... then we were stuck in all that London Heathrow mess with no way out.  But let's rewind, shall we?  A beautiful snowy day spent at Covent Garden.  No better way to warm up after shopping in the beautiful winter snow than to get a warm cappuccino and lemon drop crepe (lemon and sugar) at Crème de la Crêpe .... A beautiful little space, cavernous, yet still bright.  Girly and pink, with polka dots everywhere.  The crêpe was delicious.. nice and light, and the coffee was absolutely good.  I suppose their negative comes out of their positive in that it is such a small space, it was difficult to fit all their customers in...and especially on such a cold day like December 18, there were certainly a lot of people trying to fit into the small space.  We were lucky enough to find ourselves a little corner, and happily enjoyed all our yummy goodness!

photos.caption: Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Creme de la Crepe - London, United Kingdom

t5sjqMBssUTWGiKlsvrvkA.text: I would have given this place, 5 stars but the first time that my boyfriend and I went...the server was a bit rude. We woke up early and went exactly at the time that they were supposed to be open, in which we waited outside because they didn't let anyone in. One of the workers left the door open and put the Open sign, so I told my boyfriend "Let's go in" as soon as we went, another worker was like "It's not opened" and out the door we went. However, other than that bad experience...the crepes were awesome (cheeky monkey). We went the next day, the crepes didn't disappoint but I wish places where the food is awesome also had good customer service.
